content.question: Based on the researchersâ€™ hypothesis that the mutant allele is sex-linked, which of the following is closest to the expected number of wild-type females and the expected number of yellow-bodied males in the <math alttext="F 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> generation?

choices.label: <math alttext="123" overflow="scroll"><mn>123</mn></math> wild-type females and <math alttext="123" overflow="scroll"> <mn>123</mn> </math> yellow-bodied males
<math alttext="61" overflow="scroll"><mn>61</mn></math> wild-type females and <math alttext="184" overflow="scroll"> <mn>184</mn> </math> yellow-bodied males
<math alttext="123" overflow="scroll"><mn>123</mn></math> wild-type females and <math alttext="369" overflow="scroll"> <mn>369</mn> </math> yellow-bodied males
<math alttext="184" overflow="scroll"><mn>184</mn></math> wild-type females and <math alttext="123" overflow="scroll"> <mn>123</mn> </math> yellow-bodied males

content.answer: <math alttext="123" overflow="scroll"><mn>123</mn></math> wild-type females and <math alttext="123" overflow="scroll"> <mn>123</mn> </math> yellow-bodied males
